onSuccess.displayText:
{_Random:With no one to look after him but himself{_AddAttr:dexterity+1}|Having had to fend for himself all his life{_AddAttr:strength+1}|With no guardian in sight}, {Player} grew up alone in the forests of {Forest1}, amongst wild animals. In such a harsh environment, he could only survive by {_Random:using his latent angelic powers to their fullest extent{_AddAttr:constitution+1}|using magic to strengthen his body and heal his wounds{_AddAttr:magic+1}|relying on his sheer strength to overpower his foes{_AddAttr:strength+1}}. However, without someone to mentor him in the ways of the arcane, his control of magic was crude at best.

One day, {Player} was found by hunters from the nearby kingdom of {Kingdom#Name}. Like many other kingdoms, {Kingdom#Name} worshipped the Angels as deities, and would submit to their will {_Random:without question|unquestioningly}. {Player}, however, was not an Angel to them. After all, Angels were supposed to have horns and wings! All the hunters saw was a feral boy with unusual magic powers.

In an attempt to bring {Player} back to the kingdom for scientific study, the hunters chased him through the forest for days on end. This chase eventually led them into the territory of a fearsome predator: the three-headed, fire-breathing {Monster1}. As the hunters were being attacked, they let out a cry for help.
choices: {Player} {_Random:leaves the hunters to fend for themselves|abandons the hunters|turns his back on the hunters}
